sentences.english: Marian teased George about his big glasses.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗安取笑喬治的大眼鏡。

sentences.english: I enjoy being made fun of. I enjoy making mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 我不怕被別人取笑，我不怕犯錯。

sentences.english: Teasing can be overwhelmingly negative yet delivered with positive emotion.
sentences.chinese: 取笑可以在極消極的情況下仍傳遞積極情緒。

sentences.english: Painting their face white, they made fun of them by imitating their deans.
sentences.chinese: 他們把臉塗成白色，模仿他們的主任來取笑他們。

sentences.english: Also in making fun of butyl man?
Humor is the Ch'an mind of wis-dom that laughs at self, not others.
sentences.chinese: 幽默是睿智的禪心，它是自我解嘲，而非取笑別人。

sentences.english: I wouldn't look in the mirror and my father teased me.
sentences.chinese: 我不照鏡，因而我父親總是取笑我。

sentences.english: Jape helps, as far as arithmetic allows.
sentences.chinese: 取笑幫助，就算術而言允許。

sentences.english: Magnitsky began to make fun of Stolypin's earnestness.
sentences.chinese: 馬格尼茨基開始取笑斯托雷平的急躁情緒。

sentences.english: Yes, the other families in the audience will make fun of it.
sentences.chinese: 當然嘍，觀衆席裏的其他家庭也許會取笑我們。

sentences.english: Aardvark. ?Yes, the other families in the audience will make fun of it.
sentences.chinese: 當然嘍，觀衆席裏的其他家庭也許會取笑我們。

sentences.english: She is making fun of you and trying to embarrass you into trying harder.
sentences.chinese: 她在取笑你並盡力讓你知恥而後勇。

sentences.english: It fails when Edgar makes fun of him and they argue.
sentences.chinese: 當埃德加取笑他的時候，他們發生了爭執。

sentences.english: We like to bait him about his gaudy ties.
sentences.chinese: 我們愛取笑他戴的俗氣而華麗的領帶。

sentences.english: His crazy ideas made him the target of their jokes.
sentences.chinese: 他的古怪使他成爲他們取笑的對象。

definition: to taunt/to ridicule/to jeer at/to treat coldly/to abandon
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to chat and laugh/to crack jokes/to banter
